meanings.definition: Relating to or caused by the chemical effects of light.
meanings.sent1: The photochemical reaction only occurs when light is present.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the photochemical properties of different materials under sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The photochemical process was so sensitive that even a small amount of light triggered it.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a photochemical effect on everyone around her, brightening their moods instantly.
meanings.sent5: The photochemical changes in the leaves during autumn create the beautiful colors we see.

meanings.definition: A substance that undergoes a chemical change when exposed to light.
meanings.sent1: The photochemical reacted quickly when placed under the UV light.
meanings.sent2: The photographer used various photochemicals to develop the images in the darkroom.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the bottle of photochemical, causing a colorful mess.
meanings.sent4: The photochemical resembled a chameleon, changing its properties under different lighting conditions.
meanings.sent5: The photochemical in the solution transformed into a vibrant hue upon exposure to sunlight.
